## Important Note: Git repository in user folder?

::: fragment

 - Please make sure that your `recipe` repository is in a suitable place (e.g. desktop, documents...) and **not** e.g. in your user folder

- If this is the case, please **tell Lennart**
 
:::

::: fragment

To prevent ever creating a Git repository inside your user folder, you can use:

```{bash}
touch ~/.git
```

Thanks to [Eamon Caddigan](https://social.coop/@eamon/112434377857903339)

:::

## Implementation Exercises

1. Upload your repository to GitHub

1. Create a new repository on GitHub.
1. Set the remote URL to your GitHub repository.
1  Push your repository to GitHub.

2. Clean up your repository

If you have unnecessary files in your repository:

1. Click on the file you want to delete and choose **Delete file**
1. **Commit** the change and choose a **commit message**
1. **Pull** the changes to your local repository
